image.altText: A closeup of two panting labradoodles with golden matted fur with round pink tongues hanging out.

props.synopsis: With Tasmania's government pledging it's "committed to improving animal welfare" in abattoirs, experts say all animal cruelty laws must be toughened or another "puppy farm" outrage will occur.

title.children: With labradoodles just the latest outrage, experts plead for tougher laws against cruelty in Tasmania

image.altText: A finger pressed into the gap under a wall where the foundation has crumbled.

props.synopsis: A GJ Gardner Homes franchisee may have been trading while insolvent since early 2020. Then came more than 1,000 pages of complaint data about poor and defective works — but it was still able to sign up new customers for four years.

title.children: Things were about to go horribly wrong with a house build. But no-one seemed to be listening

image.altText: A sign with LGH and emergency written on it.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man is charged with criminal code assault after a baby was taken to a Launceston hospital with serious injuries.

title.children: Man charged after baby treated for serious injuries at hospital

image.altText: Scott Roth addressing players during a basketball match.

props.synopsis: The coach of the Tasmania JackJumpers demands the National Basketball League to do more stop abuse of players and their loved ones on social media after online attacks were directed at a player's pregnant wife.

title.children: Comments turned off after online abuse of NBL player's wife

image.altText: A blonde and brunette women sit together, smiling for a photo. There are wine glasses on the table in front of them.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians go missing every year, so what's it like spending years grieving and searching for answers?

title.children: 'Predatory behaviour': Psychics accused of exploiting grieving families

image.altText: a man playing the poker machines

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government promised mandatory pokies pre-commitment cards with daily limits, but some advocates are worried the premier is walking the reforms back. Airlie Ward chats with state political reporter Lucy MacDonald.

title.children: Listen to TassieCast 🔊 Is the state backing away from nation-leading pokies reforms?

image.altText: A man with a white beard and hair  wearing a black t-shirt and jeans sits on rocks by the water.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Braddon independent MP Craig Garland says he has tested positive for cannabis at a roadside drug test, and police found a small amount of the drug in his car.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Tasmanian MP's postive roadside test for cannabis

image.altText: Composite Shayna Jack celebrating and in yellow swim cap

props.synopsis: From vilified "drug cheat" to Olympic gold: The story behind Shayna Jack’s extraordinary return to the winner's circle.

title.children: A doping scandal, a freak accident and a secret illness: Inside Shayna Jack’s comeback

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: The treasurer will seek to burnish his diplomatic credentials in a speech on Monday, revealing that he has held about 150 meetings with foreign counterparts since Labor took government.

title.children: Chalmers to detail diplomatic efforts, including meeting with possible Trump pick for US treasury secretary

image.altText: A steel ladder on the side of an outdoor pool.

props.synopsis: Gastro cases explode in 12 months, with the cryptosporidiosis parasite causing a large number of children to get sick.

title.children: Gastro cases in Australia have exploded. What does that mean for children?

image.altText: A woman with short purple and black hair stands solemnly in a medical centre with naloxone

props.synopsis: Since 2022, the federal government has invested $26.1 million to help make naloxone, a medicine that blocks the effects of opioids, widespread. Yet some pharmacists are still choosing to not stock the medicine.

title.children: As opioid deaths surge across Australia, pharmacists still choose to not stock naloxone

image.altText: A young mother sits on the floor holding a little boy, both smiling.

props.synopsis: After giving birth to Henry from her mother's donated womb, Kirsty Bryant began showing signs of organ rejection before she could have another child. Despite the change in plans, she feels "so lucky" to have her baby boy.

title.children: First Australian woman to give birth after uterus transplant undergoes hysterectomy

image.altText: A centenarian holds a photo of her young self while sitting her couch at home

props.synopsis: At 19, Margot McCormick quit working for her dad to join Australia's largest women's service branch — the organisation which paved the way for women to join the air force.

title.children: On Remembrance Day, 101-year-old Margot McCormick reflects on how she served Australia during WWII

image.altText: A flag with the colours of the rainbow flying on a flag post.

props.synopsis: Proposed changes to the Racial and Religious Tolerance Act will balance individual rights, free speech and religious belief.

title.children: Victoria's hate speech laws set to be expanded beyond race and religion

image.altText: A lady with pink hair stands in front a clearing of bushland where a blue tent stands in the background.

props.synopsis: Castlemaine is one of the 68 locations across Australia that have a rental vacancy rate less than 1 per cent. There are said to be 600 people actively needing a house in the town yet only 10 homes listed for lease online.

title.children: Victorian family can't find a place to live as town runs out of affordable rentals

image.altText: Queensland Fire and Rescue Service

props.synopsis: Several Queensland Fire Department sources say they are worried the Gender Equity Advisory Group will be axed after a "confusing" meeting.

title.children: Queensland Fire Department moves to replace gender advisory group amid allegations of sexism and discrimination

image.altText: a driver behind the wheel at sunset

props.synopsis: An elderly woman loses an appeal to get her driver's licence back after failing two driving tests, including one where she amassed 182 penalty points — 160 more than a fail mark.

title.children: 97yo woman appeals licence suspension after amassing hundreds of penalty points in driving tests

image.altText: Princess Kate and Prince William clapping veterans at a remembrance day event

props.synopsis: To many fans' delight, the Princess of Wales is back to work, making an appearance at a Remembrance Day ceremony.

title.children: Princess Kate joins King Charles and Prince William at Remembrance Day ceremony

image.altText: Several firefighters stand on a street beside burnt cars with one holding a hose as smoke billows in an orange-pink sky.

props.synopsis: Two shops and two cars are set alight in Pascoe Vale South, in Melbourne's north.

title.children: Shops and cars destroyed in fire that is being investigated for tobacco war links

image.altText: Jacob Greig smiles at the camera wearing glasses while kneeling on the floor and doing a thumbs up

props.synopsis: Jacob Greig, 32, was denied bail as a Sydney court was told a confrontation between the pair, who were not known to each other, took place on Friday night near a campsite in Wilton.

title.children: 'I'll f***ing kill ya': Man charged with murder of teen allegedly slashed him with knife, court told

image.altText: Chef Jamie Oliver standing holding his new book wide open pretending to read it

props.synopsis: An Australian subplot in Jamie Oliver's new children's book has been accused of engaging in cultural appropriation and contributing to "erasure, trivialisation, and stereotyping of First Nations peoples and experiences".

title.children: Jamie Oliver apologises and withdraws children's book over offence to Indigenous Australians

image.altText: A woman cries in the crowd

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's victory has emboldened male supremacists to make violent threats online, but it has also led some women to swear off men altogether.

title.children: 'Delete the apps, cancel your wedding': Some American women turn to 4B after Trump victory

image.altText: Three men with rifles run through jungle

props.synopsis: Cut off from the world and mired in a deadly conflict, Myanmar is suffering from a forgotten war. But the ABC embedded with one of the many resistance groups who have banded together — and, against all odds, finally appear to be winning.

title.children: Through a muddy road, the ABC snuck into war-torn Myanmar. We found a rebellion ready to win

image.altText: Donald Trump appears on stage with wife Melania smiling and son Barron seen behind them

props.synopsis: It's been a huge week of news as Donald Trump beat Kamala Harris in the race to the White House. Here are the biggest updates in US politics you might have missed over the weekend.

title.children: The two Republicans Donald Trump has already ruled out of his new administration

image.altText: A man looks into the camera wearing a read and black sports club shirt.

props.synopsis: Tiwi Bombers are bouncing back from the brink, turning on electrifying performances in the NT Football League. A former Richmond Tiger is giving them a hand.

title.children: The Tiwi Bombers hit rock bottom in 2023. Now an AFL winner is helping turn it around

image.altText: A young boy in a school uniform

props.synopsis: Jack Davey died when a car crashed through the fence of a Hawthorn East school and hit a group of primary students.

title.children: Family and friends to gather to remember 11yo killed in Melbourne school yard crash

image.altText: An older man stands outside in an orchard looking at a cherry tree.

props.synopsis: Chiltern cherry growers Bill and Lois Hotson say customers are already placing end-of-year orders for the fruit, which is normally harvested from Melbourne Cup Day through to Christmas, and this season looks like a bumper crop.

title.children: 'Burst' of warm weather brings 'quite a good crop' of cherries after disappointing 2023 harvest

image.altText: Joseph Suaalii holds his hands to his face

props.synopsis: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii impressed in what was the most highly anticipated debut for the Wallabies in over a decade, but that was only the start as plenty excelled in England classic.

title.children: 'I had so much fun out there': Former League star Suaalii makes dream debut as Wallabies thrill and delight in England stunner

image.altText: A man performs a war dance before a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Tonga pushed Australia to the limit, the Kangaroos seemed like strangers in their own country and a Test rookie stood tall. Here's five quick hits from the Pacific Championship final.

title.children: Five quick hits: Sydney turns Tongan red and Test rookies stand tall

image.altText: Cooper Connolly has his hand checked out by a physio

props.synopsis: The tourists claim their first series win over the Aussies in Australia in 22 years, as the home side continues to struggle with the bat.

title.children: Pakistan claim ODI series in Perth with eight-wicket win

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump plans to heavily increase tariffs on Chinese imports, leaving many in China anxious about their livelihoods for the next four years.

title.children: China braces for economic strain as Trump's tariffs threaten middle class, manufacturing sector again

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson with his eyebrows raised and mouth open. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: So you think you're smart do you? Let's see if this quiz brings you back down to Earth.

title.children: Think you're a trivia champ? Dare you to score 10/10

image.altText: A woman's feet on grass with beautiful flowers.

props.synopsis: Does disconnection with the ground cause us to become sicker? That's the idea behind the practice of "grounding" or "earthing", which is growing in popularity. We separate the science from the nonsense.

title.children: Does putting your feet on bare earth balance out your electrical charge? We fact-check grounding
